context.manuscript-scope: This paper evaluates TSFM preprocessing utility, NOT classifier development. Classification (N=208, 56 events) is a downstream proxy for preprocessing quality (N=507).
context.related-plans: - manuscript-comments.xml: 41 author comments tracking - CLAUDE.md: Manuscript scope and guardrails

step.text: We define \emph{preprocessing} as signal cleaning operations (outlier detection, imputation, baseline correction) and \emph{featurization} as discriminative feature extraction from the cleaned signal. This distinction is important: TSFMs may excel at preprocessing (generic temporal patterns suffice) while underperforming for featurization (domain knowledge essential).

Preprocessing quality was evaluated on $N=507$ subjects (approximately 1 million timepoints). Classification performance was assessed on the $N=208$ labeled subset (152 control, 56 glaucoma), with classification serving as a downstream proxy for preprocessing impact rather than a primary clinical validation endpoint.

step.location: Multiple locations per DISC-03, DISC-04, DISC-05

step.text: Several limitations warrant consideration. First, this is a proof-of-concept pilot study demonstrating TSFM preprocessing feasibility, not a clinical validation study. With $N=208$ labeled subjects (56 glaucoma events) and $\text{EPV} = 7.0$ for handcrafted features, calibration instability is statistically expected~\citep{riley_clinical_2023} and does not diminish the preprocessing findings, which represent the study's core contribution. The calibration slope of 0.52 indicates model overconfidence typical of small-sample development; we explicitly chose not to apply post-hoc recalibration to avoid masking this fundamental limitation.

The observed performance gap between MOMENT embeddings ($\text{AUROC} = 0.704$) and handcrafted features ($\text{AUROC} = 0.830$) cannot be definitively attributed to representation quality without controlling for dimensionality. Future research should systematically compare embeddings at matched feature lengths (8, 16, 32, 64, 96) using dimensionality reduction techniques (PCA, UMAP, NMF) or learned adapters.

A critical limitation of current PLR analysis is the treatment of preprocessing uncertainty. Studies typically report downstream classification metrics without propagating input uncertainty through the pipeline~\citep{mure_melanopsin_2009}. Future end-to-end systems should incorporate uncertainty quantification at each stage: SAMv3 pupil segmentation (with pixel-level confidence), TSFM reconstruction (with per-timepoint uncertainty), and calibrated classification (with selective abstention for uncertain predictions).

step.related-comments: DISC-06, DISC-08, DISC-16, DISC-25, DISC-27, DISC-28
step.action: Review manuscript-comments.xml THEME-1 for all missing citations

step.text: Foundation models for ophthalmic imaging have demonstrated remarkable generalizability, with RetFound~\citep{zhou_foundation_2023} achieving state-of-the-art performance across multiple retinal pathologies and even systemic disease detection---exemplifying the emerging paradigm of ``oculomics''~\citep{wagner_systemic_2020}. While image-based foundation models have flourished, time-series foundation models for ophthalmic signals remain largely unexplored.

Recently, MIRA~\citep{li_mira_2025} demonstrated that medical-specific TSFM pretraining on ICU physiological signals can outperform generalist models, raising questions about the generalist-vs-specialist tradeoff first characterized by~\citet{kataria_generalist_2025}.

step.location: End of introduction, before structure paragraph
step.text: To our knowledge, this is the first systematic evaluation of time-series foundation models for pupillometry preprocessing. Our contributions are: (1) demonstrating that generic TSFMs achieve competitive preprocessing quality without domain-specific training; (2) quantifying how preprocessing choices propagate to downstream classification across 407 configurations; (3) providing STRATOS-compliant benchmarks for future PLR foundation model development.

step.task: Verify all numbers match between results.tex and discussion.tex

success-criteria.criterion: Pilot study framing explicit in discussion
